summary.p: 1st and 2nd kāṇṭams of Ñāṉōpatēcam of Roberto de Nobili. It appears to be a paper copy of the early books printed in 1675-1676 (see U1b, f2r18) and published in 1677-1678 at Ambalakhad, copies of which are available today in the Goa State Central Library (shelfmark "I-1a/1b Ambalacatta"; see Flüchter & Nardini 2020, note 2).
Possibly a composite manuscript by several hands.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (March 2021).

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1720 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1720 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments).

acquisition.p:
It appears to be a composite made in the library from:
le 1er Tome du grand Catechisme du Pere de nobilibus en malabare ecris à la main sur du papier qui traitte de la faussetée des Dieux des ces Indes et de l'existence du vray Dieu and Un Tome du grand Catéchisme du P. nobilibus ecris a la main sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1730 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r)
and the 2nd part of le 2e et 3e Tome du grand Catechisme du Pere de nobilibus de la compe fondateur de la mission de Maduray et font imprimés. Le 2e Tome traite de la Trinité, de l Incarnation, de la vie, de la mors, de la resurrection de notre feigneur Jesus=Chrits et du jugement univerfel. Le 3e Tome traite des prieres de l Eglise et des Commandemens de Dieu. and Un Tome du grand Catéchisme du P. nobilibus imprimé [that is, a manuscript copy made on the printed copy?] sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1729 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r). See also in Cabaton (1912, supplemented with notes) the remarks ad BnF Indien 459-460 by the R.P. Rocaries from a letter date 1966/07/02.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

R. P. ROBERTI NOBILI
ROMANI
E SOCIETATE JESU
THEOLOGI.
Qui primus Missionis Madurensis pene insuperabiles la
bores Superari posse monstravit, et Bragmanorum
vitam aggressus, ipsius difficultates et contrarietates
vincendo Missionem Scriptis, doctrina, et exemplo
instituit, stabilivit et propagavit,
CATECHISMI ROMA
NUS.

In quatuor partes distributus: Prima comprehendit sex
Dei Signa ad primam Dei cognitionem pertinentia. Se
cunda de Creatione, et de peccato Angelorum agit; nec
non de primi hominis creatione, ceteris{que} ad innocentiae
Statum pertinentibus: de peccato Adami, illius remedia;
de Redemptione mundi: de Dei Matris electione, concep
tione, et vita; denique de Conceptione Baptista
